body:
I think "programs may rely on wrap around" is correct.
A program may or may not use the wrap around feature,
and we certainly don't want to say a program have to
(must) use the wrap around.

"may disallow NUL" is also correct. We don't require each
tool to always reject NUL characters, but the fact that
some tools might reject NUL characters means you
shouldn't use NUL characters in programs if you want to
stay compatible with all implementations.
